newsitem.title: HUNGARY: DAEWOO TO INVEST $38 MLN IN HUNGARY UNIT.
newsitem.headline: DAEWOO TO INVEST $38 MLN IN HUNGARY UNIT.

text.p: South Korea's Daewoo Corporation plans to invest $7 mln in 1997 and $38 million by 2000 for developments in Hungarian ball bearings firm Magyar Gordulocsapagy Muvek Rt (MGM), Daewoo's representative said.

Daewoo, which acquired MGM in 1996, aimed at boosting MGM's production to an annual $100 million by 2000, Kim Kjong-Jan, General Director of Daewoo's representative office in Budapest was quoted on Saturday by daily Magyar Hirlap as saying.
In an interview with the daily he added that Daewoo planned to sell 8,000 to 10,000 cars in Hungary in 1997 after selling 7,000 in 1996.

Kim Kjong-Jan also said Daewoo would invest $100 million in Hungary's Raba Rt, which is a manufacturer of major bus and truck parts, if it could acquire a majority stake in Raba in its privatisation later this year.
Hungary's state privatisation agency APV Rt plans to sell its 79.27 percent stake.
